main event: A bright light was spotted on the western horizon, which disappeared in a flashing light out. Radar indicated contact at an altitude of 30-40,000 ft and a speed of 600-700 mph.
interesting points: The observer had prior ground-radar contact in July 1952 at Vandalia, Ohio.
The radar contact lasted for about 1 minute, and the light was described as being of 'very high intensity'.
An F-86 fighter was scrambled but did not make contact with the object.
The total elapsed time from start to disappearance was about 1 minute.
Investigation indicated the report was apparently accurate, and there were no balloons, aircraft, or meteors in the area at the time.
sighted object: A bright light on the western horizon
